Description: The base and most of one side of a green breccia ritual water vessel of Khamkhonsu, ovoid in form with the remains of one rudimentary handle, the exterior covered with two horizontal friezes, representing various protective deities controlling noxious animals, with eleven horizontal lines of an hieroglyphic magical/protection text - An invocation to the sun-god against crocodiles - below (covering the handle), traces of a further text panel, consisting of five incomplete horizontal registers of hieroglyphs, also remains. The text resembles that often found on cippi.
Curator's comments: Quack, J.F. 2022. Altägyptische Amulette und ihre Handhabung. Orientalische Religionen in der Antike 31. Tübingen, p. 146.
Associated titles: Invocation of the sun-god against crocodiles
